snippet: No survivors have been found from the U.S. cargo ship El Faro, which went missing near the Bahamas during Hurricane Joaquin.

byline.contributor: Lizette Alvarez reported from Miami, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York, and Frances Robles from Jacksonville, Fla. Jad Mouawad contributed reporting from New York, and Doris Burke contributed research.
byline.original: By LIZETTE ALVAREZ, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and FRANCES ROBLES

abstract: Coast Guard officials believe missing cargo ship El Faro probably sank 35 miles northeast of Bahamas, with all 33 crew members missing, no sign of survivors, and heavily damaged life raft bearing ship's markings recovered; fate of United States-flagged ship raises many questions about decision by captain of aging vessel to begin routine journey despite knowledge that Tropical Storm Joaquin was threatening to become hurricane.
lead_paragraph: No survivors have been found from the U.S. cargo ship El Faro, which went missing near the Bahamas during Hurricane Joaquin.

headline.print_headline: A Missing Ship With No Signs of Survivors
headline.main: El Faro, Missing Ship, Has No Sign of Survivors
